paragraph.heading: 2Compiling

list.item: Select Use existing Ace (control file) and click OK
Choose the Ace file. For saving the preferences to the Windows registry choose registry.ace, for saving to XML choose xml.ace
Choose the directory where the project will be compiled, by default the same directory containing the Ace file.

paragraph.heading: 2Running
paragraph.paragraph: After launching the application, you will see a window displayed with 2 buttons. When clicked each will display a window showing the preferences, one is the default view provided with the library, the other is a custom view for purposes of example.

In each dialog you can select the preferences and alter the values. When exiting the dialogs clicking OK will save your changes to the data store, clicking Cancel will not. If you then reload again the preference values will reflect the changes made in the previous session.
2Under the Hood
This example shows you how to acheive the following tasks:
Create preferences using the library supplied preference types and associated views
Use the default widget for viewing preferences and manipulating their values
Create a custom preference type (a preference for storing correctly formatted directory path names)
Create a widget to view and change the custom preference type value
Create a custom view for an existing preference type (a check view for BOOLEAN_PREFERENCE rather than a combo box)
Create a custom manager to register custom types to the system
Create a custom dialog for viewing all the preferences
